page.title: 11ST.MARY'S HOSPITAL
page.content: Opposite the church in the village of Tattingstone is a hospital.It is called St.Mary's.Many years ago in the mid 1700's it was a workhouse and in the small piece of land known as the wildlife sanctuary there are paupers graves .People would also go to St. Mary's if they were going to have a baby. About 1947 the hospital was changed into a National Health Hospital.Today it caters for chronically sick and old people.It has about 160 patients and doctors visit the hospital regularly. For the local inhabitants of Tattingstone who have no full time doctors surgery a surgery is held in the hospital every 2nd and 4th Wednesday in the month at 2.30.At other times people have to go to the surgery at Holbrook.
